name: git-log--graph
description: git log --graph, an interactive Git Graph frontend

git-log--graph.actions.global.markdownDescription: List of Git actions that are always visible in the top nav bar, left of the refresh/search buttons. `title` and `description` apply to the buttons, `args`, `options` and `params` to the popup. Please refer to the interface for a better understanding, also check the default values. The default values have `immediate:true` set, that's why you normally don't really see the popup when you click e.g. on 'stash pop'. THESE COMMANDS ARE CLI EXECUTED AS IS, SO BE CAREFUL EDITING THEM. YOU CAN LOSE ALL YOUR DATA IF YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING. However, if you do, please also consider [sending in a PR or issue](https://github.com/phil294/git-log--graph) with the action snippet if you think is is helpful to the majority of users.

git-log--graph.actions.commit.markdownDescription: List of Git actions to show that can be applied on a commit. These are shown when selecting a commit. `params` can contain the special string `{COMMIT_HASH}`. `title` and `description` apply to the buttons, `args`, `options` and `params` to the popup. Please refer to the interface for a better understanding, also check the default values. THESE COMMANDS ARE CLI EXECUTED AS IS, SO BE CAREFUL EDITING THEM. YOU CAN LOSE ALL YOUR DATA IF YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING. However, if you do, please also consider [sending in a PR or issue](https://github.com/phil294/git-log--graph) with the action snippet if you think is is helpful to the majority of users.

git-log--graph.actions.stash.markdownDescription: List of Git actions to show that can be applied on a stash. These are shown when selecting a commit. `params` can contain the special string `{COMMIT_HASH}`. `title` and `description` apply to the buttons, `args`, `options` and `params` to the popup. Please refer to the interface for a better understanding, also check the default values. THESE COMMANDS ARE CLI EXECUTED AS IS, SO BE CAREFUL EDITING THEM. YOU CAN LOSE ALL YOUR DATA IF YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING. However, if you do, please also consider [sending in a PR or issue](https://github.com/phil294/git-log--graph) with the action snippet if you think is is helpful to the majority of users.

git-log--graph.actions.branch.markdownDescription: List of Git actions to show that can be applied on a branch. These are shown when selecting a commit. `params` can contain the special string `{BRANCH_NAME}`. `title` and `description` apply to the buttons, `args`, `options` and `params` to the popup. Please refer to the interface for a better understanding, also check the default values. THESE COMMANDS ARE CLI EXECUTED AS IS, SO BE CAREFUL EDITING THEM. YOU CAN LOSE ALL YOUR DATA IF YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING. However, if you do, please also consider [sending in a PR or issue](https://github.com/phil294/git-log--graph) with the action snippet if you think is is helpful to the majority of users.
